5-Tube Holder RV Door Spray Can Storage Box for Silicone Sealant, Mastic, Caulk Adhesive Tubes - Van/Workshop/Garage RV Accessories

Keep your RV workshop or garage organized and efficient with this 5-Tube Holder RV Door Spray Can Storage Box. Specifically designed for silicone sealant, mastic caulk, and adhesive tubes, this handy storage solution provides a dedicated space to keep your essential tools within easy reach.

The robust construction ensures secure storage and prevents accidental spills or leaks, keeping your work area clean and clutter-free. The convenient design allows for quick access to the tubes you need, streamlining your workflow and saving valuable time.

This versatile 5-tube holder is designed to keep your spray cans organized and accessible in your RV, van, workshop, or garage. Crafted from durable silicone material, it features five individual compartments to securely hold sealant, mastic, caulk, and adhesive tubes.

  • Five Compartments: Accommodates up to five standard-sized spray can tubes.
  • Silicone Construction:
    • Flexible and durable silicone material for long-lasting use.
  • Secure Grip:
    • Holds tubes firmly in place, preventing spills and damage during transport or storage.

This 5-tube holder is designed to fit standard-sized spray can tubes commonly found in RV, van, workshop, and garage settings. The silicone construction allows for a flexible and compact design.

Keeping your spray cans organized is essential for any DIY enthusiast or professional. This holder provides several key benefits:

  • Organized Workspace: Eliminates clutter and makes it easy to find the right tube quickly.
  • Reduced Risk of Damage: Securely holds tubes in place, preventing accidental drops or crushing.
  • Convenient Storage:
    • Ideal for RVs, vans, workshops, garages, and more.

Simply place the holder on a flat surface within your RV, van, workshop, or garage. Insert your spray can tubes into the individual compartments. The silicone material will securely grip the tubes, preventing them from moving around.
